subject: Data
title: Scatter Plots: Finding Hidden Relationships
description: A 60-second lesson on Scatter Plots: Finding Hidden Relationships.

hook.text: Is there a link between ice cream sales and drowning deaths? A scatter plot reveals the shocking truth.

buildup.text: Scatter plots place one variable on X and another on Y. Each dot is one observation.

discovery.text: Clusters, trends, and outliers become visible immediately. Correlation jumps off the page.

twist.text: Ice cream and drowning both rise in summer ‚Äî it's heat, not ice cream. Correlation isn't causation.

climax.text: Scatter plots reveal relationships, but interpreting them correctly requires critical thinking.

punchline.text: Dots don't lie. But they can mislead the careless.

quiz.question: What important lesson do scatter plots teach?
options: Scatter plots only work with small data
